extra.source: U.S. Census Bureau: Geographic Terms and Concepts

name: New England City and Town Area (NECTA)
description: NECTAs are an alternative set of geographic entities, similar in concept to the county-based CBSAs defined nationwide, that OMB defines in New England based on county subdivisions—usually cities and towns. NECTAs are defined using the same criteria as county-based CBSAs, and, similar to CBSAs, NECTAs are categorized as metropolitan or micropolitan.
